sections.heading: License
sections.text: not to be used by person other than to whom issued; disciplinary action.

sections.heading: Disciplinary
sections.text: action against licensees.

sections.heading: Grounds
sections.text:
for disciplinary action: Failure to establish place of business; conducting

business from unauthorized location; insolvency; furnishing false information;

failure to prove employment or good character; other conduct; obtaining

contents of examination.

sections.heading: Grounds
sections.text:
for disciplinary action: Deceptive advertising; misrepresentation; failure to

disclose; failure to provide copy of certificate of installation; inducing

falsification of credit application; failure to obtain acknowledgment of

notice.

sections.heading: Grounds
sections.text:
for disciplinary action: Compensation from certain exclusive agreements;

conflicts of interest; paying unlicensed person; commingling; allowing

unlicensed person to engage in acts requiring licensure; failure to account for

or remit money or to discharge final judgment; acting as agent and undisclosed

principal.

sections.heading: Grounds
sections.text:
for disciplinary action: Substandard or unsafe workmanship; failure to honor

warranty or other guarantee; performing act requiring licensure in grossly

negligent or incompetent manner.

sections.heading: Grounds
sections.text:
for disciplinary action: Revocation or denial of license; failure to maintain

license or to respond to notice; failure to take corrective action or permit

access; violation of order, agreement or law; convictions and certain pleas;

fraudulent dealing.

sections.heading: Disciplinary
sections.text:
action against licensed dealer or distributor for knowledge of unlawful act of

employee or associate or failure to maintain adequate supervision; disciplinary

action against general serviceperson or specialty serviceperson for knowledge

of unlawful act of employee or associate.

sections.heading: Suspension
sections.text:
of license for failure to pay child support or comply with certain subpoenas or

warrants; reinstatement of license. [Effective until the date of the repeal of

42 U.S.C. � 666, the federal law requiring each state to establish procedures

for withholding, suspending and restricting the professional, occupational and

recreational licenses for child support arrearages and for noncompliance with

certain processes relating to paternity or child support proceedings.]
